title: Outcry in Egypt as iconic Nile houseboats are destroyed
description: The last homes are being removed as part of what officials say is a plan to beautify the waterfront.

title: Why ex-French colonies are joining the Commonwealth
description: Behind the Commonwealth's allure as it welcomes Gabon and Togo into its ranks.

title: How Michael Gardner helped transform Miami's nightlife
description: The businessman overcame racial barriers to become one of Miami’s foremost nightlife promoters.

title: Paris attacks: Survivors who found friendship in marathon terror trial
description: The 2015 Paris attacks left 130 people dead and some of the survivors have formed a unique bond.

title: Invisible disability: Living with inflammatory bowel disease
description: Inflammatory bowel disease sufferers say the lack of toilets is the worst thing about living in London.

description: The return of Hong Kong to China in 1997 is still a polarising topic for residents now living in the UK.

description: A BBC investigation has gathered evidence of the repeated use of cluster munitions in the city of Chernihiv, northern Ukraine.

title: Deborah James ‘taught us how to live and how to die’

title: Wimbledon: Nick Kyrgios admits spitting towards 'disrespectful' fan
description: Nick Kyrgios admits spitting in the direction of a "disrespectful" supporter after beating Britain's Paul Jubb in his first-round match at Wimbledon.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell: We still want answers, says survivor
description: Epstein victim Annie Farmer says Maxwell's sentence will help bring some sense of justice.

description: Annie Farmer testified in court against Jeffrey Epstein's associate in December, sharing how manipulative Maxwell was.

title: Why I kept my sexuality a secret at work
description: An aircraft engineer explains how he ditched his 'double-life' at work and created an LGBT+ network.

title: Brexit protester: We're not giving up as amplifiers removed
description: Protester Steve Bray reacts to police removing his amplifier after his noisy protest outside Parliament.

title: Ukraine war: Kremenchuk shopping centre attack claims fact-checked
description: Russia's government and its supporters online spread a number of false claims after the bombing.

title: Wimbledon: Ryan Peniston into second round but Katie Swan beaten
description: Britain's Ryan Peniston makes a superb start to his Wimbledon debut as he overcomes Swiss player Henri Laaksonen, but Katie Swan is beaten.

title: Russian threat means UK army needs more cash, says Ben Wallace
description: Ben Wallace says there should be further increases in military spending to keep people safe.

description: A Russian missile hit a busy mall in Ukraine. The BBC spoke to some of those who were inside.

title: Lewis Hamilton and F1 condemn Nelson Piquet's racially abusive language about British driver
description: Lewis Hamilton says "archaic mindsets need to change" and have no place in Formula 1 after three-time world champion Nelson Piquet uses racially abusive language about him.

description: Last year's census shows one of the biggest population rises ever recorded.

description: Manchester United reach broad agreement of £56m with Barcelona for the Netherlands midfielder Frenkie de Jong.

description: A perfectly planned romantic proposal goes awry when the ring bounces into a lake.

title: Queen appears at armed forces parade in Edinburgh
description: It is the 96-year-old monarch's second public appearance since arriving in Scotland on Monday.

title: Non-essential petrol sales halted for two weeks in Sri Lanka
description: The country says it is saving its limited fuel supplies for vehicles used for essential services.

title: Gabriel Jesus: Manchester City and Brazil forward having medical at Arsenal before £45m move
description: Manchester City and Brazil forward Gabriel Jesus is having a medical at Arsenal before a £45m move.

title: Nazi camp guard, 101, given five years for aiding murder
